name: Useful links.txt - To search Ubuntu Packages
description: This section provides a link to the CVE (Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures) tracker for Ubuntu, which is a database that tracks and reports on security vulnerabilities in Ubuntu packages. This resource can be useful for users, developers, and system administrators to stay informed about potential security risks and take appropriate measures to mitigate them.
use_cases: Checking for known security vulnerabilities in Ubuntu packages
Monitoring security updates and patches for installed packages
Assessing the security risk level of a particular package or version
Staying informed about the latest security advisories and vulnerabilities

name: Useful links.txt - CVE tracker
description: This section provides a link to the official Ubuntu cloud images for Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS). These images are pre-configured and optimized for running containerized applications on the EKS platform, which is a managed Kubernetes service provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS). The link allows users to access documentation and resources related to these canonical images, which can help streamline the deployment and management of Kubernetes clusters on EKS.
use_cases: Deploying containerized applications on Amazon EKS
Setting up and managing Kubernetes clusters on AWS
Utilizing pre-configured and optimized Ubuntu images for EKS

name: Useful links.txt - EKS canonical Images
description: This section provides a link to the Ubuntu Cloud Images locator, which is a resource for finding and accessing Ubuntu cloud images. These images are pre-configured virtual machine images designed for use in cloud environments, making it easier to deploy Ubuntu-based systems in the cloud.
use_cases: Deploying Ubuntu-based virtual machines in cloud environments
Building and configuring cloud infrastructure with Ubuntu
Automating the provisioning of Ubuntu instances in the cloud
